title: 104_hr3561
content: The Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Expansion Act of 1996, also known as the "Improved Efficiency in Health Care Resource Management" Act, repeals a sunset provision and introduces cost recovery measures by allowing billing of health-plan contracts. The Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Expansion Act of 1996 allows the United States to recover charges for care or services provided to primary beneficiaries with health-plan coverage from the beneficiary's health-plan contract. Funds received from the health-plan contract are credited to the facility that provided the care. The United States has the right to recover charges for care provided to primary beneficiaries from their health-plan contract, enforceable under specific sections of the United States Code. SEC. 3. SHARING AGREEMENTS FOR HEALTH CARE RESOURCES. Repeal of Section 8151 in title 38, United States Code, involves redesignating sections 8152 to 8158. Section 8152 is amended to revise authority for sharing agreements related to health care resources. Section 8152 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to revise authority for sharing agreements related to health-care resources. This includes changes such as inserting "health-care resources" instead of "resources" and expanding the entities eligible for agreements to include medical schools, health-care providers, insurers, and other entities or individuals. Additionally, adjustments are made to ensure appropriate flexibility in negotiating payment to the Department. The amendment to Section 8152 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary to make arrangements for providing services to non-veterans under certain conditions, ensuring no denial or delay in care for veterans. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of title 38, United States Code related to providing services to veterans. Amendments include changes to cross-references and sections to improve services for eligible veterans at facilities. Amendments are made to various sections of title 38, United States Code to improve services for eligible veterans at facilities by updating cross-references. Amendments to section 712(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code require the reporting of the number of positions in the Department held by individuals providing health-care resources under specific sections.
